movesets.name: Choice Scarf

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

Psychic and Ice Beam are the main STAB moves to either revenge kill Pokemon or hit them extremely hard. Shadow Ball hits opposing Ghost- and Psychic-types such as Slowpoke and Wynaut, while Hidden Power Fighting hits pesky Dark- and Steel-types. Lastly, Trick can cripple an opponent and afterwards allow Smoochum to switch moves if it needs to.

Set Details

With a Choice Scarf, Smoochum is able to hit extremely hard and become a powerful revenge killer. It can Trick its Choice Scarf to cripple opponents, giving away its item in exchange for a possibly better one. With 240 EVs in Special Attack, its attacks can put a dent in any team. It also has 240 Speed EVs to hit 16 Speed, which the Choice Scarf boosts to 24 Speed. A Modest nature is preferred to boost Smoochum's already amazing Special Attack even higher, as 24 Speed is enough to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame.

Usage Tips

Revenge killing is the job of the Choice Scarf set, and it can be used late-game to finish teams off or to cripple a single opponent. Bear in mind that Smoochum will be locked into a single move, so prediction is key. It should Trick away its Choice Scarf onto foes that threaten the rest of your team, or on a predicted ineffective move like Sucker Punch. Smoochum should always try to come into battle unscathed, so make sure that all entry hazards have been removed.

Team Options

Smoochum appreciates entry hazards just as much as any other Pokemon, so a Pokemon with Stealth Rock or Spikes can help greatly. Trubbish is a good teammate as it can check Pawniard as well as set up Spikes for Smoochum. It also appreciates Rapid Spin support. A physically bulky Rapid Spinner or Defogger can clear entry hazards for Smoochum, while also taking hits for it. A good option would be Tentacool to take Bug- or Fire-type moves, or Drilbur to take Rock-type moves and check Steel-types such as Honedge and Pawniard. Snover works well with Smoochum as its hail allows Smoochum to use Blizzard as a hard-hitting, perfectly accurate STAB move. Houndour once again makes a great teammate, as it absorbs Fire-type moves, resists Dark- and Steel-type moves, and appreciates Smoochum's ability to check Fighting-types.

movesets.name: Setup

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Ice Beam and Psychic are the main STAB moves, which hit common threats such as Vullaby, Timburr, Mienfoo, and Croagunk. Substitute allows Smoochum to safely avoid status, and possibly gain a free turn. Alternatively, Nasty Plot can boost Smoochum's already amazing Special Attack even higher. Hidden Power Fighting deals with the Dark- and Steel-types that would otherwise counter Smoochum, such as Pawniard, Aron, Shieldon, Houndour, and Magnemite. Shadow Ball is another option that can catch Slowpoke and other Psychic-types off-guard.

Set Details

240 Special Attack EVs give Smoochum a great deal of power. 240 Speed EVs along with a Timid nature allow to hit a valuable 17 Speed, which is great in Little Cup. This Speed allows Smoochum to outspeed most non-Choice Scarf Pokemon as well as Speed tie with threats like Mienfoo. With 0 HP IVs, it takes minimal damage from Life Orb recoil.

Usage Tips

Setting up, preferably with Memento or dual screens support from a teammate, should always be the focus of this set, as a Nasty Plot or Substitute is necessary for proper sweeping. Avoid priority moves at all costs as they hurt Smoochum greatly.

Team Options

Many Pokemon complement Smoochum nicely, and it has an abundance of well-suited teammates. Houndour makes an especially good teammate, as it can absorb Fire-type moves, resists Dark-, Ghost-, and Steel-type moves, and Smoochum can check Fighting-types for it. Smoochum appreciates entry hazards just as much as any other Pokemon, so a Pokemon with Stealth Rock or Spikes, such as Ferroseed, can help immensely. Smoochum appreciates Rapid Spin support even more, due to its frailty and weakness to Stealth Rock. A physically bulky Rapid Spinner or Defogger can clear hazards for Smoochum while also taking hits for it. A good option would be either Tentacool to take Bug- or Fire-type moves, or Drilbur to take Rock-type moves and check Steel-types such as Honedge and Pawniard. Archen is also a good choice as it can Defog and use U-turn to keep offensive momentum. Along with entry hazards, Smoochum also needs substantial team support, such as a dual screens user, to help it take hits and set up with Substitute or Nasty Plot.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Avalanche
moves.description: Doubles in power if damaged by the target.

moves.name: Blizzard
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Calm Mind
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confusion
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Copycat
moves.description: Uses the last move used in the battle.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Covet
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt. Only works if target is asleep.

moves.name: Dynamic Punch
moves.description: Confuses the foe.

moves.name: Echoed Voice
moves.description: Power increases when used consecutively.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fake Out
moves.description: The user always moves first, and flinches the foe. Can only be used on the first turn out.

moves.name: Fake Tears
moves.description: Lowers Special Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Frost Breath
moves.description: Always results in a critical hit.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Hail
moves.description: Summons hail for 5 turns.

moves.name: Heal Bell
moves.description: Cures status on the user's team.

moves.name: Heart Stamp
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Helping Hand
moves.description: Increases power of ally's moves by 50%.

moves.name: Ice Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.description: Lowers foe's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.description: Blocks critical hits for 5 turns.

moves.description: Bounces back certain non-damaging moves.

moves.description: Held items have no effect for 5 turns.

moves.name: Mean Look
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Meditate
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Mega Kick
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Mega Punch
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.description: Picks a random move.

moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.description: Nullifies evasion. Allows Psychic-type moves to hit Darks.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Nasty Plot
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Nightmare

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Perish Song
moves.description: All active Pokemon faint after 3 turns.

moves.name: Pound
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Powder Snow
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense 1 stage.

moves.name: Psyshock
moves.description: Damage is based on the target's Defense stat.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Recycle
moves.description: Restores a used up item.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.description: Lowers damage from physical attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Role Play
moves.description: Copies the foe's ability and overwrites the user's ability.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Seismic Toss
moves.description: Does damage equal to the user's level.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Signal Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Sing
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep.

moves.name: Skill Swap
moves.description: The user and the target trade abilities.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Sweet Kiss
moves.description: Confuses the target.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Trick
moves.description: Switches items with the foe.

moves.name: Trick Room
moves.description: Slower Pokemon move first for 5 turns.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.description: Repeats for 2-5 turns. No Pokemon can sleep during these turns.

moves.name: Wake-Up Slap
moves.description: Double Base Power if used on a sleeping foe.

moves.name: Water Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Wish
moves.description: Heals 50% of max HP after 2 turns.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

abilities.name: Forewarn
abilities.description: Tells which of the opponent's moves has the highest Base Power.

abilities.name: Oblivious
abilities.description: Grants immunity to infatuation, Captivate, and taunt.
